org.modelio.vcore.smkernel.mapi

Interface MMetamodelFragment


  • public interface MMetamodelFragment
    A metamodel fragment.

    The runtime metamodel of Modelio is composed of several fragments:

    • Modelio metamodel fragments covering UML and BPMN standards, provided by Modelio application, always present
    • extension metamodel fragments provided by application extensions (eg: Modules)
    Note the Modelio kernel does not know anything about metamodel fragment providers and that the above description is there only for the sake of clarity. Practically, once initialized with its composing fragments the Metamodel is only a repository for known MClass instances.

    Modelio and provider version management

    The fragment has a Modelio version and a provider version.

    Metamodel fragments are often a port from a tool to Modelio and this porting may be made in several steps.

    • Each porting should result in an increase of the Modelio version.
    • When the source tool metamodel changes, the Modelio version should be modified and the provider version should reflect the new metamodel version from the provider tool.

    Metamodel compatibility checking convention

    Compatibility checking should be done by looking at the Modelio version as following:
    • if major == 0 : old version numbering before Modelio 3.4
    • major version different : major migration or migration impossible
    • minor version different : migration needed
    • release version different : can be opened by newer metamodel

    Comparison

    Two metamodel fragments are equal if their name and version are equal. The vendor is only informative.
    Since:
    Modelio 3.4
    Author:
    cmarin

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The mandatory name of this metamodel fragment. Must be distinct from any other loaded metamodel fragment. Examples: org.modelio.metamodel.standard
        Returns:
        name of this metamodel fragment.

      • getVersion

        Version getVersion()
        The version of the metamodel fragment for Modelio.

        Compatibility checking must be done as following:

        • if major == 0 : old version numbering
        • major different : major migration or migration impossible
        • minor different : migration needed
        • release different : can be opened by newer metamodel
        Returns:
        The version identifier.

      • getProvider

        java.lang.String getProvider()
        The optional name of the provider of this metamodel fragment, typically the vendor. Example: Modeliosoft
        Returns:
        name of the provider

      • getProviderVersion

        java.lang.String getProviderVersion()
        The metamodel version for/from the provider tool.

        This provider metamodel version is purely informative and should reflect the metamodel version from the source tool.

        Metamodel fragments are often a port from a tool to Modelio. This porting may be made in several steps. Each porting should result in an increase of the Modelio version. When the source tool metamodel changes, the Modelio version should be modified and the provider version should reflect the new metamodel version from the provider tool.

        Returns:
        The metamodel version for/from the provider.

      • isExtension

        boolean isExtension()
        Tells whether this metamodel fragment is an extension or a standard Modelio metamodel fragment.

        By default all metamodel fragments are extension fragments.

        Standard Modelio metamodel fragments are guaranteed to have no metaclass name collisions.

        Returns:
        true if the fragment is an extension, false if it is a Modelio standard fragment.

      • getNeededFragments

        java.util.Collection<VersionedItem<MMetamodelFragment>> getNeededFragments()
        Returns:
        the metamodel fragments needed by this fragment.
        Since:
        3.6

      • isFake

        boolean isFake()
        Tells whether this metamodel fragment is a fake metamodel fragment. A fake metamodel fragment represents a missing metamodel fragment. Fake metamodel model metaclasses are all fake metaclasses.
        Returns:
        true if this metamodel fragment is fake.

      • getDynamicBehavior

        default <T> T getDynamicBehavior(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Returns the dynamic behavior to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this key has no mapping.
        Parameters:
        key - the key whose associated behavior is to be returned
        type - the class of the dynamic behavior to get
        Returns:
        the dynamic behavior to which the specified key is mapped, or null if key has no mapping
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the mapped behavior does not match the given type
        Since:
        3.8

      • addDynamicBehavior

        default void addDynamicBehavior(java.lang.String key,
                                java.lang.Object value)
        Add a dynamic behavior for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified behavior is to be associated
        value - behavior to be associated with the specified key
        Since:
        3.8

      • removeDynamicBehavior

        default void removeDynamicBehavior(java.lang.String key,
                                   java.lang.Object value)
        Removes the dynamic behavior for the specified key only if it is currently mapped to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified behavior is associated
        value - behavior expected to be associated with the specified key
        Since:
        3.8
